title: No Audio to or from the Focusrite.
steps: Ensure the Windows settings are configured to use the Focusrite as Input and Output. Settings > System, Sound, Volume Mixer > Focusrite USB Audio.
Check the Applications settings to ensure that the correct audio input and output devices are selected.
Verify that the Focusrite is detected by the computer. Open the Focusrite Control Software and if it says "No Hardware Connected", unplug and replug the Focusrite USB cable.

title: No video feed from the Capture Card.
steps: Ensure the Capture Card is properly connected to the computer and the camera.
Check the video settings in the streaming software to ensure the correct Capture Card is selected as the video source.
Verify that the camera is powered on and set to output video through HDMI or SDI, depending on the Capture Card type.
Power cycle the Capture Card by unplugging it and plugging it back in.
Plug in directly to the video switcher and use from there if possible.

title: Audio from focusrite is looping back into the stream
steps: Make sure you are not sending the output of the Focusrite on the mixer back to the input of the Focusrite.
Make sure that the channel settings are not set to loopback in the Focusrite Control Software.

title: Computer is not getting Ethernet Connection
steps: Ensure that the Ethernet cable is properly connected.
Swap to a different Ethernet port in the room.
Try swapping the Ethernet cable with a another one.
